never_claim: That JAQL supports streaming input (it does not)
That JAQL uses recursion or generator-based pipelines
That JAQL supports SQL or advanced query optimizations
That safe_eval is sandboxed at OS level (it is AST-only)
That JAQL normalizes hyphenated keys into identifiers
That JAQL guarantees stable sort order unless specified
That JAQL supports concurrency or parallel pipelines
truths_that_must_be_observed: safe_eval uses AST and only AST
pipe_select filters; pipe_project reduces fields; pipe_derive expands fields
data is always a list of dicts
multi-document YAML is parsed into multiple lists
operational_restrictions: do not increase JAQL's execution model complexity
do not implement databases or stateful storage
do not implement your own YAML or JSON parser
do not introduce threading or multiprocessing
llm_disallowed_phrases: safe_eval is equivalent to Python eval
